summary: DynamoDb functional code added to MLKit
description:
Title: DynamoDB functional code added to MLKit

Value Statement: As a Tenant ML Engineer who wants to leverage DynamoDB for their use case, I need to integrate the DynamoDB code from the tutorial notebook into MLKit so that tenants can further leverage DynamoDB to validate and run create, read, update, and delete operations.

Acceptance Criteria:
-When DynamoDB logic from the tutorial notebook is incorporated, users have the ability to manage DynamoDB operations within MLKit.
-MLKit supports validation of basic DynamoDB operations such as create, read, update, and delete.
-The DynamoDB tutorial is updated to demonstrate the new MLKit-based DynamoDB functionality.

summary: Claims Sum: validation of roles under Claims Summ
description:

Acceptance Criteria:
- Performed domain validation on new claims sum domain
- Ensured inference profiles for nova models are in a working state

Dependencies: Claims Sum intake completed

summary: EVA: convert lambda to image based
Grafana alerts for stuck batch inference jobs
description:
Value statement: As a solutions engineer who supports the ratings sum team, I need the ability to add alerts in grafana for stuck batch inference job so that the team is notified when a batch inference job is stuck and they can take action as needed.

Acceptance Criteria: - defined a max run time a batch inference job can be stuck in each state - created grafana alerts to notify the ratings sum team when a job has a runtime over the allowed threshold.

Create basic bedrock agent dashboard for MLOps use

AC: -Create panels in tenant dashboards so that they are able to see their agent's status. -Identify other key metrics that can be used and added to help gain more insight into their agents.

summary: Refactor compositions A–G to use global environment config for XPKG readiness
description:
Refactor compositions A–G to use global environment config for XPKG readiness

Story: As a BIP-AI Engineer, I want to evaluate Crossplane packages (XPKG) for delivering specific versions of our compositions and XRDs so that I can version control and release changes granularly without forcing unrelated updates. Assumptions: - SBX cluster access is available for package installation and testing - Necessary tooling (crossplane CLI or build tooling) and registry access are available - A minimal dummy composition/XRD (e.g., single bucket resource) is acceptable for testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given current Crossplane/XPKG documentation when I review and summarize then a document exists in bip-ai-infrastructure describing packaging, versioning, and deployment for small composition/XRD groups - Given a dummy composition and XRD when I build an XPKG locally then the package builds successfully with a semantic version tag and is ready to push to a registry - Given SBX cluster access when I install the test XPKG then the XRD and Composition are available and a single-resource (bucket) reconciles successfully - Given the independent package installation when I deploy only the test composition then no other compositions/XRDs change and cluster health remains stable - Given the research outcomes when I document the process then the repository contains a step-by-step runbook including tooling, commands, and rollback guidance - Given a defined approach when I create a follow-on ticket then the ticket outlines next steps for adopting XPKGs and links the documentation Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

summary: Research XPKG packaging to enable composition-level versioning and decoupled releases
description:
Research XPKG packaging to enable composition-level versioning and decoupled releases

Story: As a BIP-AI Engineer, I want to evaluate Crossplane packages (XPKG) for delivering specific versions of our compositions and XRDs so that I can version control and release changes granularly without forcing unrelated updates. Assumptions: - SBX cluster access is available for package installation and testing - Necessary tooling (crossplane CLI or build tooling) and registry access are available - A minimal dummy composition/XRD (e.g., single bucket resource) is acceptable for testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given current Crossplane/XPKG documentation when I review and summarize then a document exists in bip-ai-infrastructure describing packaging, versioning, and deployment for small composition/XRD groups - Given a dummy composition and XRD when I build an XPKG locally then the package builds successfully with a semantic version tag and is ready to push to a registry - Given SBX cluster access when I install the test XPKG then the XRD and Composition are available and a single-resource (bucket) reconciles successfully - Given the independent package installation when I deploy only the test composition then no other compositions/XRDs change and cluster health remains stable - Given the research outcomes when I document the process then the repository contains a step-by-step runbook including tooling, commands, and rollback guidance - Given a defined approach when I create a follow-on ticket then the ticket outlines next steps for adopting XPKGs and links the documentation Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

summary: Develop claim template for Strands Agent deployments
description:
### Title
Develop claim template for Strands Agent deployments

### Value Statement  
As a platform engineer managing application deployments, I need the ability to deploy strands agents to Kubernetes using a claims template so that deployments can be performed in a standardized and repeatable manner.

### Acceptance Criteria  
A Stands Agent is successfully deployed using the claim template

### Dependencies  
This story is dependent on the completion of: BIP-29909

summary: Deploy Go Crossplane Manager to SBX Management for gateway and resources view validation
description:
Deploy Go Crossplane Manager to SBX Management for gateway and resources view validation

Story: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to deploy our Go-based Crossplane manager and MFE into the SBX Management cluster so that we validate the gateway routing and All Resources view and prepare for rapid iterations of the manager/worker model. Assumptions: - SBX Management cluster access is available for deploy and test - Manager and MFE container images are built and accessible from the registry - Required configuration (secrets, environment settings, gateway/ingress) is available or provisioned Acceptance Criteria: - Given SBX Management cluster access when I deploy the Go Crossplane manager and MFE then all pods reach Ready and services report healthy status - Given the gateway configuration when the MFE is deployed then the gateway route responds HTTP 200 and serves the application UI - Given the MFE application when I navigate to the All Resources view then resources load successfully and reflect the current Crossplane-managed state - Given the manager connection to Crossplane when reconciliation runs then no errors appear in logs and basic list/read operations succeed - Given the deployment in SBX Management when I run smoke tests then gateway routing and All Resources view checks pass Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

2 Update Harness service account role up2date to match current jenkins role.

summary: Research OTEL collectors for integration with CloudWatch
description:
Title: Research OTEL collectors for integration with CloudWatch

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer, I want to research what options we have to collect OTEL traces so we can better log agent traces

AC: Documentation on what is available natively in AWS or other self hosted services to collect OTEL traces. Including Xray, Lambdas, K8s endpoints. Show pros and cons of each, how to set up each one, cost, and technical feasibility. Also, show how to integrate it with an OTEL client.

- Add metrics for agent evaluation (tool use accuracy, task completion rate, latency, tokens used)
- Analysis of evaluation frameworks to use - AWS owned, open source, custom

summary: Harness SOP for BIP AI Tenant Teams
description: Value Statement: As a platform/DevOps team member I want a clear, standardized operating procedure for using Harness to build, deploy, and manage releases So that deployments are consistent, secure, repeatable, and easy to support across environments and tenants.

summary: Harness SOP for Internal Team
description:
Value statement: As a platform/DevOps team member I want a clear, standardized operating procedure for using Harness to build, deploy, and manage releases So that deployments are consistent, secure, repeatable, and easy to support across environments and tenants.
AC: Create a documented SOP that defines how the team should use Harness end-to-end, including: Pipeline and template standards Environment promotion process (Stage → Preprod → Prod) Approvals/governance gates Delegate usage, troubleshooting, and operational checks Rollback and incident response steps Required training/onboarding steps for engineers

summary: Create inputset for SPA - for unified Lambda pipeline

Create inputset for SPA - for unified Lambda pipeline

AC: Create a new Input Set named for SPA that can be selected when running the lambda code deployment pipeline

Acceptance Criteria - met w/ SE's that have tenants who deploy SM pipelines - Clearly defined the inputs and outputs - Mapped out detailed deployment workflow that works for all tenant use cases - Received approval from lead and SE w/ most complex SM pipeline deployment workflow

summary: investigate self hosted langfuse
description:
Title: investigate self hosted langfuse

summary: 1/12 Demo- Helm chart Refactoring
Monthly Deliverables
Monthly Status Report
Implement Call Image Builder Pipeline within Tenant Agnostic pipeline
description:
As a platform/DevOps engineer supporting BIP AI multi-tenant deployments, I want a tenant-agnostic “BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline” that calls the existing Image Builder pipeline, So that I can reliably kick off tenant-specific image builds from a single orchestrating pipeline with consistent parameters, governance, and traceability.
Pipeline “BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline” exists in the tenant-agnostic area and is manually runnable.
Pipeline is tenant-agnostic (no tenant-specific hardcoding); changing tenantId does not require code changes.
Pipeline triggers the Image Builder pipeline exactly once per master pipeline run (when validation passes).
Master pipeline outputs the downstream Image Builder run ID/build number and a link/URL to the downstream run.

summary: Implement call for Lambda deployment Pipeline within tenant Agnostic
description:
As a DevOps engineer supporting BIP AI multi-tenant deployments, I want the tenant-agnostic BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline to call the Lambda Deployment pipeline, So that I can deploy/update tenant-specific Lambda functions consistently from a single orchestrating pipeline with standard inputs, controls, and traceability.
BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline includes a stage/job to trigger the Lambda Deployment pipeline from within the tenant-agnostic pipeline.

summary: Determine performance metrics and standards to track
description: Value Statement: As a bip-ai engineer, I need to create a confluence page that outlies what can be tracked with agents outside of inputs and outputs so that we are able to gain more insight into such as tool use, tokens, time spent and personal identifiable information concerns that may arise. AC: - Confluence page that outlies what can be tracked with agents outside of input and output - Include PII concerns with logging inputs/outputs.

summary: Research and Document Github Agent HQ (SOP/Best practices)
description:
Value Statement

As an infra engineer, I need to understand GitHub Agent HQ architecture and best practices so that I can implement a secure and maintainable agentic AI solution for IAM automation.

Acceptance Criteria
 * Document GitHub Agent HQ core capabilities
 * Define security requirements for agent implementation
 * Identify key best practices and integration patterns
 * Documentation reviewed and stored in knowledge base

summary: create prototype Github Agent Runner on prem

Acceptance Criteria - Set up on-prem GitHub Agent Runner infrastructure - Configure agent authentication to GitHub and AWS - Implement basic IAM policy generation workflow - Demo working prototype to stakeholders

summary: research self hosted Jira MCP
description: Value Statement As an infra engineer, I need to investigate self-hosted Jira MCP integration so that I can enable automated JIRA task generation from IAM requests. Acceptance Criteria - Research self-hosted Jira MCP capabilities - Document Jira API integration requirements - Define automated task creation workflow - Create technical design document with findings

summary: 2.1 - On Call Infra Service Desk
description:

 # Address any tickets that come in and begin support

 # Reassign to developers as needed

summary: Create Harness SageMaker Pipeline Deployment Pipeline
description:
**Value Statement** As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create a Harness Template for SageMaker pipelines , so that we can deploy and manage SageMaker pipelines directly from Harness.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse. - The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use. - Permissions and secrets are managed securely in Harness. - Documentation is provided for how to use and modify the pipeline template. - The pipeline is validated by running at least one end-to-end SM pipeline deployment.
